intro: Dioclea scabra, commonly known as the hairy spider-plant, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, often covered in fine hairs. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Dioclea scabra is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
